content: Anyone interested leading or co-leading a SMART App Launch track at the January 2022 Connectathon? We'd love to grow the community.
@adam strickland , @Cooper Thompson, @Matt Sargent , @Jason Vogt
Thanks @Isaac Vetter , hey @Josh Mandel , I'm interested in co-leading. Have any resources I can look at to start?

Yes, that would be awesome @adam strickland ! We might have slightly missed a deadline but if we get a "track proposal" sketch together over the next couple of days I think we'll be fine. We can start from the https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-09+SMART+App+Launch+v2 and tweak for a Jan 2022 proposal.

The track lead basics/responsibilities are outlined at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Connectathons
(Clarification: the track proposal deadline is tomorrow so we are in time to get a placeholder proposal in.)
I'd be happy to set up time in the next week to talk through organization, goals, etc if you're interested in leading!

How did the last track go @Carl Anderson? I think most of the scenarios there are important and would be worth a second pass.

I think one topic (though I'm not sure how to make this a scenario) is to talk more about the fhirContext structure. I know Epic has been meaning to advocate for the addition of standard, top-level parameters such as location, loginDepartment and appointment. Is that something that's been discussed?
@Josh Mandel sorry I didn't get back sooner. I have not had much bandwidth this week and wasn't prepared to jump on this.

No worries! I've got a placeholder submitted. Let's look for time to strategize next week? Testing fhirContext would be great.

(FYI Carl's not actively working in the fhir community anymore, though he may still have eyes here.)
Hey @Josh Mandel , do you think we could meet sometime this Friday to talk about this? Pretty much anytime other than 12:30-1pm CST works for me.
